title: Jimmy Carter National Historic Site: Resources for Local Educators
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Parks as Classrooms     Resources for Local Educators                Resources for Local Educators        Park Ranger Patty Kuehn visits with local school children. NATIONAL PARK SERVICE   Â    A Park Ranger will visit your class (Pre-K to 8) to talk with students on a variety of subjects related to Jimmy Carter. Our rangers read to the younger students while teaching the older students about Jimmy Carter from his childhood, to his political life and his return to his hometown. These programs are offered year round to schools within a two hour drive of the park. Please contact Patty Kuehn here or by calling 229-942-0045 for more information.
